clinical_study.brief_title: Fluid Balance and Body Weight Changes in Critically Ill Adult Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Fluid Balance and Body Weight Changes in Critically Ill Adult Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: Positive fluid status has been consistently associated with worse prognosis in critically ill adult patients.However, observational studies showed poor agreement between fluid balance and body weight changes. The objective of the study is to compare the measurements of FB and BW over time and to assess correlation with ICU mortality.

detailed_description.textblock: Positive fluid status has been consistently associated with worse prognosis in critically ill adult patients. Daily and cumulative fluid balance (FB) is a routine nursing activity in intensive care unit (ICU). In view of the potential for errors in the calculation of FB totals and the problem of accounting for insensible fluid losses, measurement of body weight (BW) changes is an alternative non-invasive method commonly used for estimating body fluid status. Its accuracy over FB assumes a one kilogram change in BW equates to a one liter gain or loss in body fluid volume. However, observational studies showed poor agreement between those measurements, particularly among individuals staying more than a week in ICU possibly due to muscle and fat loss as well as bone demineralization. The objective of the study is to compare the measurements of FB and BW over time and to assess correlation with ICU mortality.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between daily fluid balance (difference between fluid input and output during 24 hours) and the change on daily weight
primary_outcome.time_frame: At midnight every 24 hours up to patient's ICU discharge or up to 6 months, whichever comes first.
primary_outcome.description: Correlation between daily fluid balance and weight change (Bland-Altman agreement test)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between cumulative fluid balance and total weight change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Last day of each patient's ICU hospitalization, up to 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between cumulative fluid balance and total weight change (Bland-Altman)

secondary_outcome.measure: Discriminative power of fluid balance in predicting ICU mortality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Area under ROC curve for fluid balance (L). ICU mortality as reference variable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Discriminative power of body weight changes in predicting ICU mortality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Area under ROC curve for body weight change (kg). ICU mortality as reference variable.

arm_group.description: Adult patients consecutively admitted to the ICU from June to October 2018 are eligible if expected length of stay is superior to 24 hours and no oral nutritional has been offered.

intervention.description: Clinical demographic data, daily and cumulative FB (input minus output) with and without insensible fluid losses, and daily and total BW changes are recorded, as well as survival outcome.

study_pop.textblock: All adult patients consecutively admitted to the ICU from June to October 2018 are eligible if expected length of ICU stay is superior to 24 hours and no oral nutritional is being offered.
